page.lettertext:
fol.282r
Belgia: 1590 Oc
t
.
Belgia 1590 Octo
b
To my L. Trea
s
May it please yo
r
L. to bee advertised, that after I
had sent my laste to yo
r
L. the laste of Sep
t
the
verie same daie I receaved yo
rs
of the 15 w
th
her
Ma
ties
l
res
to the Townes. And becaus it was first the
advise of
M
r
Buis
that her Hig
nes
should write to the
severall Townes, I acquainted him p
nt
ly w
th
the teno
r
of the l
res
, and w
th
the nomber that was signed
requesting his direction about the deliverie. In his
opinion they were written to verie good purpose & will
steed her Ma
ty
exceedinglie, for many respect
. Chieflie
for the terrefieng of those, that are so opposit in all
thing
to her Hig
nes
desires. The onelie want that hee
doth finde is, that nothing is written to
Harlem
,
TerGowde
,
Gorichem
,
Rotterodame
,
TerGoes
, w
ch
are principall
Townes, and send their Deputies to the meeting of the
States. There are also other to bee spetially regarded,
as
Enchusen
,
Hoorn
, Camphere. Albeit there are some of
these more honestly affected then some others, & yet in
his Judgement, the best affected of them all are as
soone to bee dealt w
th
all, and happelie sooner then the
woorst. For hee knoweth the nature of this people
to bee so tender, that the Townes will esteem yt for a
singular honno
r
, to bee required to doe anie thing, by
peculiar letters from her Ma
ty
, and repute it otherwise
for a kinde of contempt, the greater townes in spetiall
if they bee not that waie respected, aswell one as
an other. Again if it come in deliberation in any
publick assemblie of the generall States, what course is
to bee taken for her Ma
ties
satisfaction, it is the forwardnes
of the most devoted, that will drawe the other places to
a good resolution. In consider
ao
n wherof, least her Hig
nes
should bee frustrate of those good effect
, that her letters
may produce, hee hath wished mee in any case
to endevoure
by all meanes possible, to endevoure that her Hig
nes
may
bee intreated, to signe other letters to the foresaid townes
and to delaie the delivery of these in my hand
till the
rest bee receaved. Upon so good demonstration of
reason, as to my understanding, was made unto mee, I have
fol.282v
Belgia: 1590: Oc
t
.
presumed to follow his advise, and to beseech yo
r
L. to
entreat her Hig
nes
for the signing of letters to those
other Townes, to the end I may addresse them to
theyr places altogether: as in the mean season I
[do]
not misdout, but by yo
r
L. meanes this litell st
[ay]
that I make, till I bee adv
r
tised of her Ma
ties
pleasure
will be construed to the best. I have c
r
tified
yo
r
L. in a former letter that
Floris tin
Advocat of
Utrecht
was dead, Among those that are proposed in
theyr new election M
r
Buis is chiefly named, Howbeyt by
the secret practise of the
Advocate of Holland
, & some
oth
rs
besides not like to bee elected, To exclud him the
sooner, they give yt out against him for a principall
cause, That her Ma
ty
doth not favo
r
him. Hee doth
not seeme
in
any sort to affect the office, having meanes
of his owne to maintain an honest port, nev
r
theles to
notifie to the world, the lewdnes of those by whom hee
is abused hee hath moved mee earnestly to become an
humble suto
r
, that her Ma
ty
would vouchsafe to write a
letter in his favo
r
to
e States & Towne of Utrecht, to the
same effect as hee
cured yt long before: requiring the
reparation of his credit among them & restitution of
certain good
, that they do wrongfully w
th
hold. To make
yt somewhat cleerer I have set downe
e substance, that
the letter should contain & I send yt heere apart, to bee
framed in such sort as her Ma
ty
shall give order.
Hee think
by this meanes not onely to attain to his right
& credit but to
e publick conviction, of those that would have
him in her Hig
nes
disgrace. I have had some experience
in this place of his unfayned endevo
rs
, to advance to the
uttermost her Ma
ties
s
vice, w
ch
in
te heer to for I have
signified to yo
r
L. as I know M
r
Wilk
will do yt more
effectually. And still I find him to continew in his wonted
disposition, deliv
r
ing his mind in all his conversation very
honorably & farely of her Ma
tyes
ceeding
, w
th
out any feare
of oth
r
mens displeasure, so as for mine own
te I
see no man of this nation w
th
out exception of any to
shew a better proofe of his honest affection. In w
ch
respect
fol.283r
Belgia: 1590: Oc
t
.
I do not dout but yo
r
L. will bee moved, to recommend
his request to the effecting of yt, to the end hee may
ceave that neither wee that are heer, have concealed
his desert
, nor her Ma
ty
not esteemed them. The fort
of Terheyd by
breda
after yt had abiden 400 shot of
e
cannon fell to composition to de
t w
th
out enseignes, armes, or
baggage, By meanes wherof those principall Townes,
Bommel
Breda,
Huesden
ar greatly relieved &
e country freed fr
o
e
enemyes oppression. It was thought very requesyt that
e forsayd fort sould be rased, w
ch
was p
nt
ly
fourmed
&
e Count as wee think ys now before
Steenberghen
from
whence we looke every howre to receave good tiding
.
Oc
t
7. 90
